messages.content:
I have this PostgreSQL statement: INNER JOIN teams t ON aa.tags->> 'ts-owner' = t.id

Will there be an error if ts-owner doesnt exist in the tags column?

No, there will not be an error if 'ts-owner' does not exist in the tags column. The INNER JOIN will simply not match any rows where the condition aa.tags->> 'ts-owner' = t.id is not met, resulting in those rows being excluded from the final result set.
Glad to hear that! If you have any more questions or need further clarification, feel free to ask.
